p: Although the climate indices were found to be significantly different in all months, the results show the summer months (June, July, and August) to be the most significantly different. These are also the key months for potential B. tabaci development outdoors. The indices showing the most significant differences between East Anglia and Mediterranean France are TG10p and TN10p: the number of cold days and cold nights that are colder than the 10 th percentile of days and nights in Mediterranean France (refer to Table A in S1 Appendix for the full index definitions).
